QCAlgorithm provides a shortcut method for the Identity indicator -- Identity(). It creates an Indicator object, hooks it up for automatic updates, and returns it to be used in your algorithm.

You can determine the specific requirements of the indicator from the reference table below.

Identity()1/3

            Identity QuantConnect.Algorithm.QCAlgorithm.Identity (
    Symbol                symbol,
    *Func<Decimal>  selector,
    *String               fieldName
   )

Creates a new Identity indicator for the symbol The indicator will be automatically updated on the symbol's subscription resolution

Parameters
Symbol symbol The symbol whose values we want as an indicator.
*Func<Decimal> selector (Optional) Selects a value from the BaseData, if None defaults to the .Value property (x => x.Value).
*String fieldName (Optional) The name of the field being selected.

Return

Identity - A new Identity indicator for the specified symbol and selector

Definition at line 876 of file Algorithm/QCAlgorithm.Indicators.cs.

            Identity QuantConnect.Algorithm.QCAlgorithm.Identity (
    Symbol                symbol,
    Resolution            resolution,
    *Func<Decimal>  selector,
    *String               fieldName
   )

Creates a new Identity indicator for the symbol The indicator will be automatically updated on the symbol's subscription resolution

Parameters
Symbol symbol The symbol whose values we want as an indicator.
Resolution resolution The desired resolution of the data.
*Func<Decimal> selector (Optional) Selects a value from the BaseData, if None defaults to the .Value property (x => x.Value).
*String fieldName (Optional) The name of the field being selected.

Return

Identity - A new Identity indicator for the specified symbol and selector

Creates a new Identity indicator for the symbol The indicator will be automatically updated on the symbol's subscription resolution

*Func<Decimal> selector (Optional) Selects a value from the BaseData, if None defaults to the .Value property (x => x.Value).
*String fieldName (Optional) The name of the field being selected.

Return

Identity - A new Identity indicator for the specified symbol and selector

Definition at line 910 of file Algorithm/QCAlgorithm.Indicators.cs.


The indicator resolution can be different from the resolution of your securities data. However, the resolution of the indicator should be equal to or higher than the resolution of your security. In most cases, this usage should be in the Initialize method. If you call this method several times, it will create a new indicator that is not ready to use.

To retrieve the numerical value of any indicator, you can use the Current.Value attribute of the indicator.

private Identity _identity;
// In Initialize()
_identity = Identity(symbol, resolution);

// In OnData()
if (_identity.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _identity.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.identity = self.Identity(symbol, resolution)

# In OnData()
if self.identity.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.identity.Current.Value
